creditline: Gift of Barbara Bretz House in memory of Robert Vincent Cram and Gertrude Schill Cram
description: Tall Case Clock from the home of Samuel Adams.
medium: Mahogany with white pine and various metals (works)
text: According to family legend, this clock once stood in the Boston house of the Revolutionary War patriot Samuel Adams (1722-1803).  Adams is best known for confronting the Royal Governor, Thomas Hutchinson, over the Boston Massacre of 1770, and demanding that British troops leave Boston.  Adams inherited a successful malt-producing company, the inspiration for today's Samuel Adams Brewing Company based in Boston.
title: Tall case clock
